column2: text
This was the sword that Walach used to cut down the true Grand Master of the Order of the Blood Dragon. Its keen edge means red ruin to any who dare oppose him.
This chalice contains the life blood of the greatest opponents Walach has slain in battle. Their pure and noble blood is a potent source of power to any Vampire who drinks it.
Crimson Blade
Blood Chalice
This banner instils Harkons knights with the legacy of vengeance after Mikael, second in command to Walach was slain.
Blood Dragon Standard
Blood Dragon Standard
This banner instils Harkons knights with the legacy of vengeance after Mikael, second in command to Walach was slain.
A powerful weapon to be used against the undead, though it's twisted malevolence torments its wielder with visions of impending undeath.
Orb of Chalcidar
Forged by Malach the Cruel, this sword easily dispatches the undead not that the living shouldn't fear it too.
Blade of Malach
The Shield of Ptolos is magically inscribed with a myriad of distracting patterns and designs that magically send arrows and bolts spinning off course.
Shield of Ptolos
Shield of Ptolos
The Shield of Ptolos is magically inscribed with a myriad of distracting patterns and designs that magically send arrows and bolts spinning off course.
The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.
Barded Nightmare
Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.
Zombie Dragon
Claiming the souls of the living, trapped inside the sword. once filled allows the summoning of great warriors
Soulreaper
Barded Warhorse
A Sheikh will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.
Camel
Warhorse
Barded Warhorse
Elephant
Mark of the Hashishin
Camel (Jezzail)

One major advantage the camel provides for these mounted archers is simply a better angle for their arrows to aim true than from their horse counterparts. Albeit, mounted archery on a camel is no easy task!
An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.
The barded steeds of the nobles are the greatest chargers from a nation that prides itself on its equestrian pedigree.
Elephants are unstoppable beasts. Trained on the battlefield, they lead Araby's leaders to war, wiping out everything that gets in their way.
After years of service and loyalty, a Hashishi will receive the mark of the brotherhood.
Armed with long-barrelled arquebus of Arabyan design, the endless deserts have taught these men the value of marksmanship and an accurate firearm.
Serpent Staff
Black Book Of Ibn Naggazar

Inside this ornate staff decorated with snake motifs is bound a malignant and ancient Serpent Djinn, imprisoned by powerful enchantments woven by Jaffar. Only Jaffar's will is strong enough to temporarily unleash it upon his enemies on the battlefield.

Ibn Naggazar was a brilliant, if somewhat maniacal Arabyan sorcerer. Whilst it is unknown whether his madness sprang from isolation, too many attempts at creating intoxicating elixirs or the honeyed promises of whispering daemons. There can be np doubt he was utterly insane.
Camel
Jaffar is a vainglorious man, it is no wonder then that the prestigious camel is one of his favourite mounts to ride into battle.
Royal Elephant
From on top the howdah of a mighty Arabyan Royal Elephant, Sultan Jaffar gazes down upon the battlefield with only imperious cruelty and disdain in his eyes.
A fine-blade presented to Arabyan Warriors who have proved themselves in battle, gaining them respect from all.
It is said that Armour fashioned from the carapace of the Dune Scorpion is stronger and lighter than any metal variety.
This strange mystical amulet allows its wearer magical powers but it is a heavy burden some can not bear.

Hailing from the highest peaks of the World's Edge Mountains, Arabyans just like the northern Imperials are willing to pay vast sums of gold for a single egg or chick such is the renown of these majestic beasts.
Falcon Scimitar
Scorpion Carapace Armour
Crescent Amulet
Griffon
Royal Elephant
Elephants are unstoppable beasts. Trained on the battlefield, they lead Araby's leaders to war, wiping out everything that gets in their way.
Rattlesnake Staff
Those proven proficient in magic are gifted the Rattlesnake Staff by the Wizard Caliph, it is the mark of any good Arabyan sorcerer.
An esoteric, daemonic blade, its ghostly form in eternal transience between shape and shadow.
The Blade of Shadows
The fragile bones are protected by legion armour.
Barded Skeletal Steed
Animated by vile magic, the bones of this once proud steed still show a reflection of the grace it possessed in life.
Skeletal Steed
Built in the style of the Tomb Kings, only the highest officers of the Dread Legion will take to the battlefield on top of this chariot.
Dread Legion Chariot
Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Albion Warhorse
The chariots built in Albion might look crude to more civilized folk, but they are well constructed and surprisingly dangerous on the field.
Albion Chariot
Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Albion Warhorse
Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Albion Warhorse
Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Albion Warhorse
Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Albion Warhorse
Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Albion Warhorse
The only giant raven who has ever been spotted in the skies of Albion serves Morrigan as her loyal companion, allowing her to take to the skies whenever she desires to do so.
Dubh'neach
Morrigan is rarely ever seen without this staff which looks like a mere branch of a random tree. But those who know what to look for easily notice that it brims with magical power.
Seann'darach
The fine nose of this animal detects hidden enemies and alarms his master if unseen foes are near.
Blood Hound
This frenzied warrior will fight the enemies of Albion wherever he encounters them.
Woad Raider
Maybe this is a messenger of Morrigan's Flock, maybe he is just a tame Raven. Be it as it may, this bird faithfully accompanies its master, always on the hunt for glittering objects.
Raven Companion
Druidic Advisor
Truthsayers who are too old or fragile to continue serving on the battlefield or casting exhausting spells will often serve as advisors to chieftains and warleaders.
Chieftains are figures of authority among the tribes. Not all of them fight on the battlefield, but even those who do not will help the war effort by maintaining order on the battlefield.
Chieftain
Not many warriors of Albion are skilled or lucky enough to make it to old age. Those who do inspire the younger men of their tribe with stories of valor.
Old Warrior
Sacking and looting settlements is sometimes required for the survival of the tribe. And some tribesmen are better at it than others.
Plunderer
Women of Albion may choose to take up arms, just like men. Those who do not are expected to learn a craft such as healing or hunting.
Tribes Woman
Truthsayers will sometimes use Fenbeasts as bodyguards. Their inability to betray their masters and intimidating appearance makes them well suited for this task.
Fenbeast
Members of the Hearthguard serve as bodyguards for important chiefs, warleaders and druids.
Hearthguard Bodyguard
A Truthsayer who is still learning his craft. He is already able to manipulate the winds of magic to his favour though.
Druid Neophyte
This hardened warrior has seen many battles. His calm, stalwart presence inspires the warriors of the army and his knowledge in warfare is very beneficial.
Veteran Warrior
This grizzly banner is a reminder of the more savage aspects of the culture of Albion. It is decorated with skulls and bones of slain foes, both beast and human alike.
The Banner of Trophies
Not many travel alone through the dangerous wilds of Albion. Those who do are either foolhardy or exceptionally skilled - sometimes both at the same time.
Lone Wolf Huntress
Those who fight under the Banner of the Earth goddess benefit from her protection.
Banner of Danu
Only in times of war would hunters bother to carry a banner.
Hunter's Banner
Staff of Light
One of the best-guarded secrets of the Truthsayers is the art of forging a Staff of Light. These weapons allow the Truthsayers who wield them to hinder the magic of their opponents.
Triskele Talisman
A magic talisman with the sign of the Triskele carved into it. It is given to accomplished Truthsayers and its magic will protect them from harm.
Hammer of Giant Strength
It is said that this hammer has been imbued with the strength of Bologs, greatest of Albion's giants. It is certainly heavy enough to require giant strength to be swung around by its user.
Golden Shield of the Sun
Blessed by Lugh, the sun god, this shield burns arrows and foes alike if they are getting too close to it.
Swamp Hunter's Spear
A heavy spear designed to hunt the big, mutated beasts of Albion's swamps. It pierces the thickest hide just as well as a Fimir's armour.
Dagger of Shadows

It is said that this weapon was taken from a Fimir near the Citadel of Lead. It is turning its wielder into an excellent killer, however, there is a cost to be paid. None of its wielders seem to get very old.
Albion Chainmail
The best armour Albion can produce, favoured by its nobility and everyone else who can afford it.
Warleader's Helmet
A helmet made for leaders of armies, enchanted to enhance their voice and keep their mind calm.
Amulet of Danu
The Earthmother blesses those who fight in her name with her powers.
Talisman of Lead
Strange signs are carved into this oddly shaped talisman. If a Dark Emissary could get his hands on it, he would recognize a fragment of his master's powers sealed within.
Scepter of the Old Ones

An ancient item left behind by the mysterious Old Ones. The Truthsayer holding it might tap into its power when casting spells and even though he doesn't understand it, he can activate its magical effect.
Staff of Darkness
A Staff of Light modified by a Dark Emissary. Even though it pains the Truthsayer to do so, he can use the enemies weapons if he must, although the risk might not be worth the power it holds.
Ogham Stone Shard
The shard of an old, collapsed Ogham Stone. It still holds a fraction of its former power.
Enchanted Hound Figurine
This small wooden figurine has been enchanted to aid hunters in their dangerous expeditions.
Terrifying Trophy

Accomplished Albion Warriors often take trophies from worthy foes and have Truthsayers preserve them in secret rites. They are then worn into battle and supposed to strengthen the warrior with the power of their slain enemy.
Triskele Banner
A magic banner emblazoned with the sign of the Triskele. It is given to accomplished Truthsayers and its magic will protect them from harm.
Triskele Banner
A magic banner emblazoned with the sign of the Triskele. It is given to accomplished Truthsayers and its magic will protect them from harm.
Staff of Dural Durak
When Dural Durak casts spells, this staff of his own creation twists the Winds of Magic in a way that disturbs the efforts of enemy casters.
Amulet of the Old Ones
One of the last functioning artifacts of the Old Ones remaining in the hands of the tribes of Albion, this amulet can save the life of its wearer once per battle with a surge of magical energy.
Albion Warhorse
Albion bred warhorses are hardy, fast and sure-footed. However, only wealthy warriors can afford to ride on to battle.
Albion Chariot
The chariots built in Albion might look crude to more civilized folk, but they are well constructed and surprisingly dangerous on the field.
Staff of Dural Durak
When Dural Durak casts spells, this staff of his own creation twists the Winds of Magic in a way that disturbs the efforts of enemy casters.
Only in times of war would hunters bother to carry a banner.
Hunter's Banner
This grizzly banner is a reminder of the more savage aspects of the culture of Albion. It is decorated with skulls and bones of slain foes, both beast and human alike.
The Banner of Trophies
Those who fight under the Banner of the Earth goddess benefit from her protection.
Banner of Danu
Luthor is Larenscheld's faithful servant. He excels at ambushing, supporting his master to get rid of pesky adventurers and keeping his master safe from daggers in the dark.
Luthor the Hunchback
The fragile bones are protected by legion armour.
Barded Skeletal Steed
Built in the style of the Tomb Kings, only the highest officers of the Dread Legion will take to the battlefield on top of this chariot.
Dread Legion Chariot
A Warsphinx brought by a traitor king into the service of Nagash.
Khemrian Warsphinx
Chariot of the Hand
The Hand of Nagash is infamous an infamous charioteer. Now that he is resurrected and has regained his chariot, only misery awaits the living in his path.
The Punished One

An enemy so hated by the Hand that he was strapped on a halberd and is used as a battlestandard even after death. Those who came close enough and survived swear that the skeleton still screams in agony. Without a sound, yet unbearably loud.
The Hungering Blade
A gift from Nagash himself. When its wielder fades, the blade awakens and feeds him with the life force of its victims so he may persist against all odds.

Ugma likes to collect treasures. He carries an assortment of small trinkets with him, taken from adventurers he has bested. Some of these trophies are magical and imbue the troll with beneficial effects.
Ugma's Trinkets

Chief Ugma's oversized hammer has probably been taken from the statue of a Dwarf hero or ancestor god in the fallen Karak Azgal. Chief Umga doesn't seem to care though, all that matters is that the hammer has the right size and doesn't break.
Karak Azgal Stone Hammer
Bright and angry glow the Runes of Fury, the weapons that hold them almost jumping out of their wielders' hands in desperation to strike the foe.
A Dwarf wielding a weapon bearing the Runes of Might can fell a Giant in a flurry of axe blows.
A weapon with this rune moves to block incoming attacks, making its wielder extremely hard to hit.
The Rune of Striking causes the weapon to hit the foe’s most vulnerable area with uncanny precision.
Rune of Fury
Rune of Might
Rune of Parrying
Rune of Striking

This enchanted horn has the power to panic enemies and calm friendly troops with a single blast. When sounded, all enemy regiments within earshot may flee and all fleeing friendly regiments within range will rally themselves.
Horn of Urgok

This mighty sword has runes inscribed along the blade by a Bright magic Wizard Lord. In hand-to-hand combat the wielder strikes more accurately and ferociously against his enemies. Also, a fireball may be cast from the sword.
This sword is enchanted with the energy of Bright magic. Its magical power may be cast when the wielder is in melee, unleashing a fiery blast which wounds any troops in the vicinity.

This mighty sword channels the energy of Celestial magic through its blade. In hand-to-hand combat a successful strike wounds the enemy automatically, regardless of any armour he may be wearing. When the wielder is in melee it may be cast, summoning multiple lightning bolts from the sky which strike the enemy regiment.

Forged by a great Dwarf runesmith as a gift to the Empire, this sword has powerful Dwarf runes carved upon its blade. The sword strikes with such force it penetrates all armour, and any undead troops hit by the sword suffer twice the normal damage.
The Enchanted Shield provides the bearer's regiment with an extra level of armour. This item can only be utilised by troops who are normally able to use a shield.

The Shield of Ptolos is magically inscribed with a myriad of distracting patterns and designs. The patterns magically distract arrows and bolts, sending them spinning off course. The bearer's regiment will be protected against missiles from bows, crossbows, war engines and so on. Additionally, the shield provides the bearer's regiment with a basic level of armour.

The Spelleater Shield is inscribed with symbols which have the power to absorb enemy magic. Whenever the bearer's regiment is the target of an enemy spell the shield has a good chance of absorbing the magic and channelling its power to any friendly mages. The shield can also negate the effects of enemy magic items. Additionally, the shield provides the bearer's regiment with a basic level of armour.
This magic helmet protects the bearer's regiment from the effects of fire or flame attacks. The magical powers are so effective that almost all such attacks will be ineffective.

This powerful wand channels the energy of the winds of magic, providing the bearer with extra magical powers. Any spell in the bearer's repertoire can be cast for fewer magic points than it would normally cost, to a minimum of one point.

The banner of Arcane Warding is inscribed with sigils to twist magic aside and deflect it in unpredictable paths. When a hostile spell is cast against a regiment bearing this banner the spell is likely to be either negated or deflected towards the closest enemy regiment.
This hallowed banner has been infused with power and can lash the enemy with bolts of pure energy. It may be cast, unleashing up to six mighty lightning bolts upon enemy troops within range

This powerful banner infuses the bearer's regiment with extra courage, making them braver and more determined. A regiment bearing this banner will never break from hand-to-hand combat and is immune to fear.
Grudgebringer Sword
Hellfire Sword
Storm Sword
Grudgebringers Runefang
Enchanted Shield
Shield of Ptolos
Spelleater Shield
Dragonhelm
Wand of Jet
Banner of Arcane Warding
Banner of Wrath
Banner of Defiance
Gifted Halflings who have defended the Moot and all within are presented a magical staff from the creatures of Altern Forest.
Dried and treated Tobacco from the Greenleaf plantations are woven into impossible robes showcasing various runes of protection.
Altern Gnarl Staff
Greenleaf Battle Robes
Glammyding
The magical Halfling sword known as Glammyding increases its wielder's strength, while striking fear into Orcs and Goblins.
Bottomless Hat of Rabbit
Olorin is much admired in the Moot for hisability to pull rabbits out of his hat. Tasty rabbits, too.
Cathay Fireworks
Olorin's special reserve of fireworks from Cathay, "borrowed" from their last diplomatic mission, whenever that was.
Aragand the Layabout's Sword
An impressive, but seemingly broken, two-handed sword. Aragand the Layabout likes to ramble on about how it only appears to be broken, and is, in fact, in mint condition.
Keigel's Natural Pig Swill
Only the worst low-life scum would ever deign to put this vile concoction to the taste. Worse, the after-effects of this vile brew are painful and accompanied with much vomiting.
Legles's Friendship Bracelet
Giblit, for the sake of our friendship, please go steal from that sleeping dragon.
Ring of Concealment
The magical Ring of Concealment makes it very difficult for others to see its wearer.
Giblit's Friendship Bracelet
This friendship bracelet represents the great task of repentance that lays before Giblit, being friends with an elf for the rest of his life.
Bimbo's Book of Sage Advice
Bimbo's Book allows a Halfling leader to give some sage advice to his army. "Sage Advice" is Halfling for a good talking to.
Flying Carpet
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Djinn Vessel
Servants carrying a large Djinn Vessel.
Flying Carpet
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Djinn Vessel
Servants carrying a large Djinn Vessel.
Flying Carpet
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Djinn Vessel
Servants carrying a large Djinn Vessel.
Flying Carpet
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Djinn Vessel
Servants carrying a large Djinn Vessel.
Northern Terrorgheist
Giant bats the size of dragons, capable of plucking men from the field and stunning warhorses into paralysis.
Copher Scales
Atabeg Ornate Armor
Helm of the Sands
Dweller's Terror
Breastplate of the Lost
Tear of Uzzal
Heart of the Oasis
Gorgon Shield
Shield of Faith
Atabeg Scorpion Armor
Khrumak’s Gift
Sultan's Gilded Armour
Golden Scimitar
Hidden Blade
Corsair Soul
Hammer of the Desert
Saif Al-Janub
Dagger of Truth
Dimashque's Breath
Martyr’s Shard
Bow of Seeking
Sword of the Vengeful God
Efreet’s Blade
Weeping Blade
Idol of the Desert:
Abacus of Fate
Beetle Pendulum
Astrolabe of Desire
Crown of the Serpent Caliph
Ring of Divine Healing
Djinni’s Ring
Mask of the Faith
Holy Scriptures of Mullah Aklan’d
Ratkin Necklace
Ibn Jellaba's Compass
Twilight Mirror Shard
Flask of the Sun
Beetle of the Black Star
Cheshnakk Ring
Moonstone
Heart of Ishmail
Ancient Toy Horse
Khandu Hookah
Kadizar Rope
Golden Carafe
Laniph’s Scroll
Arabyan Puzzle Box
Whirlpool Staff
Sandstorm Staff
Cursed Book of the Dunes
Blood Scrawl of the Liber Mortis
Monkey Paw
Glimmering Monkey Paw
Bronze Monkey Paw
Monkey King's Gilded Finger
Magic Lantern
Oil Lamp
A piece of arabyan craftsmanship that provides solid defense balanced with extreme lightness.
A tremendously ornamented piece, showing the value and rank of the lucky one who wears it.
No one knows the origin of this strange artifact, but it seems to ward off all magical power that is thrown at its bearer.
This armor was created by an ancient caliph to combat the threat of a cabal of bloody vampires.

Legends tell that an arabyan princess went deep into the desert in search of her brother. The fierce girl returned wearing a shining armor, snatched from an ancient Tomb King, and no one ever knew what had happened on her travels.
Uzzal, the arabyan goddess of protection, created this armor in ancient times, to fight the dreaded demons. Ensures the health of its bearer against any monster.
This magical armor protects its wearer from the punishment of the sun, while healing their wounds. It was forged in the ancient city of Dakisir, before its destruction by the Undead.

In the Gorgon Shield, the image of a Gorgon is displayed, a horrible creature said to inhabit the deserts of Araby. It is rumored that if an enemy looks into the eyes of the face painted on the shield, it will turn to stone. This has never happened in recent memory, but the reputation of the shield is great enough that adversaries put themselves at a disadvantage by trying to avoid the Gorgon Shield gaze.

A long-forgotten smith, unswerving in his faith, created this shield. It was once held by the hero Amir Bakir who was slain as he bravely charged into an overwhelming number of enemies during the Crusades. The shield is imbued with the power of the divine and may destroy any weapon that touches it.

This armour gives the wearer the abilities of a scorpion. It was last worn by Atabeg Zankhri, who travelled from the centre of the desert after a failed assassination attempt which resulted in the deaths of all his companions. He made it back to Khalibon, only to remove his armour and become the victim of a final dagger thrust by a shadowy assailant.

This armour was given as a present by the Dwarf Lord Khrumak to the Sultan Nur Al-Zangi. The armour was a reward to the Sultan for saving his caravan from a legion of undead that rose against him as he traversed the desert. It is covered in runes that grant supreme resistance to spells.
Worn by Sultans past, this gilded ruby encrusted armour while impractical, shows the wealth and power of it's wearer and thier power hungry ways.
The skill of the Arabyan warriors is unmatched as long as they guard the nimble and sharp scimitars of their homeland.
A sharp blade hidden in the assassin’s bracer, ideal for cutting the enemies’ throats.
Bearing the blessing of the Monarch of the Sea, goddess of protection for the Arabyan sailors, this scimitar will wipe out any threat before the enemy can react.
A weapon without equal, that only the fierce and strong inhabitants of the dunes are capable of handling correctly.

Given as a gift to an imperial mercenary for his displays of courage during the Siege of Sudenburg against the Undead, this scimitar was forged by the famed Arabyan philosopher and craftsman Hataq al-Kundi at the time of the Crusade.
This dagger was found clutched in a skeletal hand and buried under a mass of bodies. The wielder of the dagger sold his life dearly.
Forged from the best steel of all Araby, this scimitar encapsulates the skill of the best master craftsmen in the city of Dimashque.

Forged by Alik the Fanatic, the Martyr’s Shard gained its power as Alik lay dying, still clutching it to his bleeding chest. His readiness to give his life to his cause infused the dagger with divine power. The dagger now allows its wielder to strike horrifying wounds, if they are prepared to offer their lives in the process.

Bow of Seeking: This bow was a gift to Princess Shah’Razad from the Elven merchants that frequent Araby as a gift for her enchanting story-telling. Made from hardest ebony, this magical bow has been the death of many monsters in Araby. Any arrow shot using this magic bow will pursue the target and hit it even if it is behind cover.
This is a famed weapon that was wielded by Abakukh the Mighty. His lust for battle was such that he was overcome by the sword after slaying every enemy that stood against him on that fateful day.

This is one of the sword’s forged by Maha Zorouzahan that is imbued with spells from the magi of the Land of a Thousand Gods. When the word’s of power are uttered, the sword bursts into flame and grants its wielder immense power.
An old blade that still oozes a strange noxious liquid, a gift from shameful times where the Ratkin were once called allies.
Representing one of the fierce gods of Araby, this statue contains the will of the spirits.
Utilizing the power of arabyan wizards, this Abacus anticipates change, warning of future threats.
With the poison of the Tomb Beetle, a powerful Pendulum is created to chase nearby vampires, widely used by the caliphs of Araby.
This ancient Astrolabe was created by astrologer/engineer Asthra the Magian. It uses sorcery and knowledge of the heavens to point the holder in the direction of what she desires most.
A power without equal creeps among the rubies of this crown, because anyone who carries it will be able to bend the wills of many around him.

The ring is an heirloom from a line of great warriors who fought for your faith. The finger that wore it was severed during battle, resulting in the warrior’s demise. The ring has the power to mend the worst damage, even otherwise fatal wounds.
Crafted with elemental sorcery, this golden ring has a Djinn bound to it. The bearer can summon the Djinn who will protect its master.

The origins of this enigmatic relic has been lost over the centuries, suffice to say that it is extremely old and very valuable. It was used by the Caliph Ibn Rashid, in his wars against the undead hordes of King Khasetratepp. The wearer of the Mask projects an aura of holiness that the undead will shy away from.

Holy Scriptures of Mullah Aklan’d: The legendary Mullah Aklan’d was the most renowned legend in the entire history of Araby, and his everlasting fight against the High Elves has been set on fire in the hearts of the Arabyans. The self-proclaimed first Grand Sultan decided to write his memoirs, secrets and teachings in the so-called Holy Scriptures.
An old necklace whose pendant bears a strange triangle, it is said it will call out to burrowing beasts to this day, a gift from shameful times where the Ratkin were once called allies.

The master explorer made use of this magical compass that always marks a true path and wards it's bearer from dangerous lands. It's orign is unknown, some say it was crafted by Ibn's own hand, others a lizardmen trinket batered for in the Southlands.

Created from a series of enchanted mirrors by the mad wizard Mahik Al'Rak, this small shard accidentally broke away after Imperial and Bretonnian crusaders stormed the tower, to gaze upon it is to gaze upon Chaos.
With a pinch of the energy from the sun inside, this device is made by the most expert alchemists of Araby.
Obtained from the deep ruined chambers of the cursed Nehekhara, this relic contains a power long forgotten.

Cheshnakk was a great wizard from Araby whose celebrated skill led to the creation of the most exquisite flying carpets. The problem of his achievements, however, was the forging of the Cheshnakk Ring. In all its power, this ring can transport its wearer back to his home.
Concentrating the power of the gods of Araby, the power that hides this artifact returns to its controller as silent as the same night.

Ishmail, the god of Araby related to night, secrets and stars, hides secrets from ages past. After creating the Djinns, this powerful deity left powerful artifacts in the mortal world, with supreme abilities that few can understand.
A toy from a bygone era, it tells of a tale of deception that brought the fall of a great city.
It is said to smoke from this pipe brings great clarity & calm. Many strange deals and allies have emerged from inhaling it's intoxicating fumes.
Hailing from the land of a thousand gods, magic ropes have allowed many thiefs to perform extraordinary feats.
When filled with water and the sacred rites incited it is said that any object that touches the now divine water is impervious to magic.
The powerful arabyan sorceress known as Laniph created strange artifacts to contain the Winds of Magic inside it.
A strange object that allows its wielder to manipulate the Winds of Magic to appease, something unpredictable in distant Araby.
The Whirlpool Staff is inscribed with esoteric calligraphy that teaches the wielder how to intercept hostile magic and dispel it.

Carved from the petrified prob of ancient, wind blasted prob, the Sandstorm Staff contains the very essence of the desert. With the help of the elves, the greatest Arabyan elementalists bound the power of the desert into these staffs, which were once thought lost to the sands.
The last writing of the arabyan necromancer Harak-Iman, it remain as a vestige of this dark art among the dunes, hidden in the distant city of Ma’arra.

Scattered across the lands of Araby are the pages of the Book of the Dead, written by the mad Arabyan, Abdul Alhazred. The forbidden lore on the pages will instill in the reader vast knowledge in the ways of death and the afterlife.

This strange and disgusting object is used mainly during the strange religious rites of the nomadic tribes of the Tuareg and has a similar power to the Magic Lamps. As with the powers of the fickle Djinns, the Monkey Paw is not always beneficial to its owner. Every time its owner makes a wish, a toe will snap shut, making it come true. But the way to fulfill the wishes is extremely twisted, always implying the torment of its owner.
Created by potent magic and modelled on it's very real forebearer, this one is made from glass, it blinds all around when the sun strikes it, it is as hard as it is fragile.
Dulled by time, this bronze work is nearly unbreakable but it's weight is unbearable.

It is said to have been a gift from the Monkey King to the far east in Cathay to celebrate the advent of trading relations thought others say it it is a cursed gift revenge for Cathay's failed invasion of the Southlands.

This finely crafted piece of jewelry is home to a benevolent Genie. He act as guardian to his master and can offer helpful advice with his powers of insight. However, his overwhelming power can become a problem.
Not all genies make home in lavish ornaments or wish to be disturbed. some prefer to stay hidden in plain sight.
Staff of Balor's Eye

At the tip of this magical staff rests an ancient Fimir artifact known as "Balor's Eye" a magically preserved eye said to belong to the myterious Fimir god, able to open a rift into the Realm of Chaos and suck all of the user's enemies within.
Crown of the Hellmother

This thorny metal crown once belonged to the First Hellmother, a Meargh who united together all the ancient Fimir Clans. The Hellmother was a potent socreress, who placed many warding and magic amplifying enchantments upon her crown. Skattach has recently found the crown in  a journey to what she claims are the ruins of the Wandering Isle, the ancient lost homeland of the Fimir, and used it to claim the controversial mantle of the Hellmother.
Camel
The mount of any self-respecting Arabyan gentleman.
Flying Carpet
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Flying Carpet
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Flying Carpet
An Air Djinn bound to a piece of furniture.
Blades of Honourable Demise
Taken by Fatandira from the tomb of the Liche Lord Karitamen in the Borderlands, this pair of Nehekharan Khopeshes magically enhance their owner's combat skills, and weakens anyone struck by them.
Cuirass of the Brave Queen

This ancient magical lamellar cuirass is said to have belonged to a legendary warrior queen of the Scythans who killed one of the great Priest Kings of Ancient Nehekhara in battle. The Scythans, believing Fatandira to be a reincarnation of that queen, have granted to her this ancient artifact.
Warhorse
Born to a family of Arabyan caravan nomads, Fatandira is as comfortable on the saddle as on foot.
Saqir

Given to Fatandira as a gift by the Scythans, Saqir is a mighty specimen of Desert Roc, giant and intelligent birds of prey that fly high above the deserts of Araby. The animal quickly bonded with her, and now they soar the battlefield together.
The Flaming Scimitar

One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus' uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn spirits. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.
Auric Robes

The Magus' ostentatious golden robes are not just a flamboyant show of wealth, they possess potent enchantments that the Magus discovered in a parchment at the ruined city of Bel-Aliad. Besides providing protection from harm, these wards are curiously nocive to the Undead.
Camel
Though vigorous and spry for his old age, the Golden Magus often rides to battle on one of his many camels - out of flamboyance if anything else.
Djinn Skiff

Much like the Magus' infamous flagship, this enchanted skiff is proof of his mastery over the Djinn. Held "afloat" on the air by servile Lesser Tempest Djinn oarsmen, this is one of the Golden Magus' favourite ways to ride to battle.
There was no quirky remark, absurd story or honey-tongued comment to save Glibfoot this time. This is the end of his "grand" tale.
Hyshia

No one is quite sure of how a Halfling adventurer has gotten his hands onto a Druchii Repeater Crossbow, and what's even stranger, the weapon is enchanted with the White Wind of Magic. Could any of Glibfoot's braggadocious tales be actually true?
Cipher Blade

Glibfoot claims that the High Elves of Ulthuan gifted him this small magical blade as thanks for single-handedly defeating a Greenskin invasion of the Asur Homeland. In reality, it is a trinket "borrowed" from the chambers of an Elven Archmage, an enchanted letter opener with the ability to magically "open" almost anything... armour included.
The Last Tale
Defeated Glibfoot Volespanker
There was no quirky remark, absurd story or honey-tongued comment to save Glibfoot this time. This is the end of his "grand" tale.

The Starblade, like its lance variant, is forged from the metal of a fallen star, the weapon's graceful lines belie the formidable power it grants its wielder.
This magical Armour of Fortune is an ancient family heirloom, and so beautifully crafted that the wearer's freedom of movement is completely unimpaired.
This finely crafted medallion has been passed down through the Stormriders for generations. Preserved with tempestuous magical knowledge, it was a gift from the Mages of Hoeth long ago.
Astride his griffon, Sharpclaw, Althran swoops down on his chosen foe and cuts them down with talon and beak.
